title: Ask HN: How do you secure your personal computer?
text:
My windows laptop is compromised. I am looking for best ways to secure it, including getting rid of windows and installing Linux, if that is the way to go.

Any advice is welcome

title: Rethinking next-generation vaccines for coronaviruses, influenza viruses, etc.
Ask HN: What are your favorite tools for generating simple documentation?
text:
I need to write some pretty simple documentation, just a general overview of a code base's structure, installation requirements, and usage. I'm leaning toward just putting everything in a README markdown file, but I might want to expand it a bit more eventually, and it would also be nice to have a static HTML file I could hand over to a team which may not have a markdown reader.

I've been looking at different documentation generators, and getting a little overwhelmed by all the options. Maybe I just need a markdown-to-html converter? What is your favorite way to write simple documentation?

title: Tell HN: Apple now requires email address verification before iCloud usage
text:
Two months ago, I posted a thread about Apple allowing iCloud accounts to exist for my domain that I hadn't created in the first place:

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33756458

That behavior seems to have changed now. Apple now seems to require email address to be verified before the iCloud account can be used:

https://imgur.com/a/ZVBf1ZZ

I don't know when this change rolled out though.

Ask HN: Minimum Viable Manager?
text:
I want to remain mostly an IC, but we're at the point where I need to dedicate some time to managing. What would be the bare essentials of a Minimum Viable Manager?

Going to start weekly 1 on 1s. I found those very helpful in my past roles (I also was lucky in that I always had great managers).

What else?

Ask HN: Can we enable reply links during noprocrast cool-down?
text:
I'm a big fan of noprocrast. 20 minute visit time, 660 minute cool-down. My basic usage of the site is to scan the front page or two once a day, and pop whatever threads seem interesting to me into new tabs. I glance at this content through the day, or, more often, I close out the tabs without really looking at them closely.

Occasionally I (believe I) have something useful to add to a comment thread, but my reply attempts are met with the noprocrast nag screen.

Thing is, at least for me, writing a reply isn't the target behavior for noprocrast. Refreshing for updates is. EG, the harmful behavior is compulsive read refreshes, not writing. If my experience is typical, then allowing the reply link during noprocrast would be a sensible default. If my experience is atypical, then it might be a nice configuration option.

Just think! You'd get to read more of my wonderful comments!
